title: When I report someone for unskilled, I don't want them in my queue the next game.
body: There was a reason I reported them, don't put them back in my queue.

replies.body:
The report helps a lot. Unskilled Player reports are used for matchmaking analysis to determine if there are players where they shouldn't be.

I totally understand the frustration of having someone on your team who didn't do so well, but there are ways to overcome it. Like banding together and pressuring that lane to help someone get back on track. I am not the greatest top laner and have been bailed out more than once by asking for help.

It's also about the communication, if you're telling someone to 'stop feeding' for example, it's probably not going to help them. Most likely they are trying their best and have fallen behind - happens to all of us. I know personally it doesn't help me if someone says that when i'm having a bad game.

What is useful though is when someone goes 'lets get this top laner back on track!' and you work with your team to get them going. 

This is just one example, the main thing is how you react when someone on your team is struggling, if you help them you can turn a sucky situation into a winning one.

> [{quoted}](name=Sephyre,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=iYPElbHl,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-05-25T04:29:22.767+0000)
>
> It's also about the communication, if you're telling someone to 'stop feeding' for example, it's probably not going to help them. Most likely they are trying their best and have fallen behind - happens to all of us. I know personally it doesn't help me if someone says that when i'm having a bad game.

'Stop feeding' is a valid request when a top laner is 0-5-0 after 5 minutes though. Requesting junglers help is good, but when they jungler leaves thats not an excuse to go feed again. Basically it means someone that is chasing kills when behind needs to pull their head in and think about the TEAM not just their kill score. 0-5-0 is fine if they then stop feeding and blaming the jungler for no ganks, when they chased a kill without vision and got ganked.

It's a bit hard to "stop feeding" against a 5-0 dude when you're 0-5.
It's easier to "swap lane", or to "get some jungle farm".

Bring your expectations into reality, man. If a guy has 5 kills and 70cs more than you, do you expect to stand a chance?

I agree with you but I can also understand where he is coming from.
I don't want X players ever being matched with me ever again.

But I understand that players have bad games sometimes (Like my last 3 today)

The problem I think is that its usually a gang up, today I had a trio (They all had Xxx at the end of there names and never flamed each other)
But decided to flame me because I was 0/5 (With 22 assist and 250 CS)

Those are the kind of players I don't want to be with, but I can understand if someone doesn't do too well.
My only other issue is when they don't learn from there mistakes.
If I don't want someone in my next game I go do something else for a few minutes then queue up. It's not rocket science.
Report the good players and just vs noobs, easy win.

then carry the game. Help them without raging but try be supportive and give them positive feedback. Be the person to show them the way...it's called being a good team mate/player. No need to be a dick and report them, it's not like it's a championship game right? geez the nerve of some people.

What if they made it so they filtered out anyone reporting decent/above average players, by taking into consideration the players overall KDA and W/L (this would also go for the unskilled players)  
That way you could report the people which consistently average 4/7/2 and had a 40% win rate and never be matched with them till they improve. 
if the 4/7/2 person increases their performance per game and it changes to 12/8/8 it removes them from the hopeless list. 

Honestly I don't know if this would help things, because there are so many bad players and a majority of games you are playing with people you have never seen before - by having these players removed from all of your games you might miss out on a free few wins when you  could've went up against them.

I suspect it would cause more problems than it would solve.

Like giving people an incentive to report everyone who plays the same role as them (particularly in higher divisions where there are less players) so that they get their role every game, which would probably massively increase queue times and mean that most of the reports weren't actually unskilled players
Report for unskilled is just a fake report anyway, nothing comes of it (unless it is like 2-3 per game) it's just a placebo.
Most easily abusable thing to do (i.e report good players, and all bad ones so you dont get them)

I said after 5 minutes. They wouldn't have 70 cs more. And if they were (time wasn't an issue), they should have asked for the jungler's help a long time ago. That's right though, you wouldn't stand a chance **in a fight with them**.
'Stop feeding' = start defending and **playing for the team**, not your kill score.

yeah same i block people and have them turn up usually only in the next game (which is still stupid) but then ive also had people who ive blocked ages ago that i dont remember anymore turn up in my game, which kind of feels like either "give them another go in your next game" or "meh this guys surely gotten better give him another go". rito plz.....6 year old game, chroma packs, overnerfing whoever you want, but none of that matters when you've got a toxic af feeding teammate
